dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks through a town, passing various stores and the g bustle of the people there. He notices a baby in a pram l out on the sidewalk, then sees the mother is in an alleyw what looks like a drug deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris reads a closure notice on the door. A police car ro up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How ya doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok. When'd the mill close?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh 3 years this August. If ya lookin  for work you might wanna try Aberdeen,  that's the closest mill work you're  gonna find around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's too bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah just simple economics. Y'know we  have a really nice casino here, the  wild cherry. You wanna make some money  maybe you wanna go on down there and  try your luck at the blackjack tables.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah I don't think so. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris turns around and the sheriff notices his name on a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Chris Vaughn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sheriff chuckles and steps out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well hell, I know all about you Chris.  I know your folks, I'm sheriff Stan  Watkins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How ya doin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralston get outta the car, you're lookin  at a real soldier here pay some respect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome home soldier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here Chris, (opens the back door) We'll  give ya a ride up to your folks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah I'm fine thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I insist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey it's my pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't take no for an answer (jokingly  reaches for his gun). HEY! Get in the  car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris raises his hands and the sheriff chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I scare ya with that one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lil bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were gone a while huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 8 years. Harstad was sheriff back then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harstad, yeah. Sad story. About 5 months  back he fell asleep at the wheel and  uhhh... hit a tree. Good man, good man  and a good sheriff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem, and uh Chris (hands him  a piece of paper). It's election month...  I'm your man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris takes the paper and smiles. He walks up the lane to the house, a simple white building clad in wood. A lady d in a police uniform comes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lil' brother.. You come over here and  gimme a hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They laugh together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I couldn't let you be the only  one looking good in uniform. Hey ma!  Chris is here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's with the tent? (points to a tent  set up on the lawn).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's for Pete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How ya doin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris hugs his mother, Connie. A man slowly emerges from front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long do we have ya for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For good. I'm home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? You're not kiddin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hug again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family are eating takeaway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish you would have told me you were  coming I would've cooked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are you gonna do now that you're  home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I was planning on working at the  mill, your letters never mentioned that  it was closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't wanna bother you with our  problems when your father got laid off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got my business, you saw the furniture  outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I substitute at the elementary school,  Michelle pitches in. We try to keep  things simple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A kid walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete! This is your Uncle Chris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Pete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down, say hello. Last time he saw  you you were barely walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now I'm camping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said you could sleep on the couch.  It was Chris' room first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your tent's gonna take on water. I could  show ya how to rig it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't look like it's gonna rain to  me Colonel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete, cmon sit down, have somethin to  eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First of all I was a sergeant. I worked  for a living.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever smoke anybody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know, Papa's still got your gun locked  up in the garage. Think you could teach  me how to shoot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured that'd be scrap metal by now  dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm still hoping that you'll melt  that thing down on your own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry Pete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever. I'm outta here Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, be back by ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten thirty (as he walks out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remind you of anyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can see from the window that it's raining heavily outs Chris sets about unpacking his things. Pete comes in look wet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok it rained. Happy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Why dontcha crash on the floor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, I'll crash on the floor, you crash  on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: uh uh. (starts walking out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete. (hands him a towel). Keep ya dry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you really kill people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crappy camper van rolls up. A man steps out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray Ray! Ahaaa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello puddin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How ya doin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that? (points to the van)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the lovemachine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girls actually get in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How ya been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Clean livin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna beer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Believe it or not I quit drinkin.  I'll take a soda though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoah. (spots a tattoo of a guitar on  Ray's arm).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya like that? When you left town it  gave me the idea that I should do something  with my life too so uhh I went down  to Seattle, got a guitar and became  all about music. And then pretty soon  I was about music and drugs, n pretty  soon I was basically just about drugs.  Ended up doin 2 years for B+E.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nahh, look at me now though right? I  been clean and sober for 14 months,  doing construction and renewing those  supportive and healthy friendships from  my past. Matter of fact I talked to  the bastards, told em you were back  and they asked me to politely remind  you that kick off's in twenty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of guys are there waiting, one of them holding a They salute as Chris walks up. They all laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Playin ball?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's play ball!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray go deep go deep! (as Ray runs off  he throws the ball into Ray's back).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Spotting a sign that reads 'HAMILTON  FIELD') When did that happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His parents hadn't left him the mill  more than 2 minutes before he shut it  down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a voice shouts 'HEADS UP' Chris catches a fast ball throw behind. Jay steps out of his vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause I opened my Casino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still got a gut huh Jay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still got your reflexes. What, you get  tired of being all that you can be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm still all I can be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? I'll just have to see about  that. What brings you home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanna relax, catch my breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You? Relax?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another truck with a few guys on it pulls up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A football game ensues, there are two teams. Jay's guys v guys. On the sidelines Pete pulls up on a small motorcycl notices Pete hanging around with kids smoking. It comes d to the last play, the teams are huddled into two groups t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we score here we win right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright boys, last play. We need to  put this to rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just give me the ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it. On the first hut!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok Vaughn, last chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris gets the ball and throws it. An opponent comes in h and tackles him low. He collapses. Ray runs for the ball gets clotheslined by Jay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's game!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Chris) Sorry about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's cool man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris Helps Ray onto his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to be back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya round. Hey, if you're not doing  anythin later on you could come by the  casino. I'll introduce ya to some nice  girls, drinks are on me. Whaddya say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay speeds off in his car. Pete rolls up on his bike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Sarge, good game. Maybe next time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold up. Maybe next time I won't see  you with the bleachers smoking weed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome home buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you have to be native american  to own a casino?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Hamilton's one sixteenth black man  now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just so you guys know, I'm gonna triple  my money tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yea, like last time. Wound up selling  your body for bus fare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had to walk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody's gonna have any problems finding  this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the subtle attention to aesthetics  that I find most impressive, blends  in with the mountains SO nicely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is packed with gambling tables and attractive w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it wonderful? All your gambling  needs under one great big roof. You  got your ATM machine, tellers to cash  your paycheck, and when you're here  you don't gotta worry about those lil  things like child support, rent, the  laws of mathematical probability.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, Mr Hamilton would like to  invite you to the VIP lounge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, 'Mister' Hamilton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heyyy, the dream team!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah well. Welcome to my world. Look  tonight, all the drinks are on the house.  If you need a line of credit, say how  much. And if you need a lil female companionship...  done. Alright? Have a good time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you goin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you worry about me, I've got a  few things to do. Enjoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just remember, nothin in here's free.  C'mon, this place is nothin but fake  boobs and real assholes if ya ask me.  Just water for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's to you Chris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all down some drinks. They lead Chris down a corrido

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say we never did nothin' for ya!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, everybody's a lil scared  the first time. Get in there, sit back  and enjoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris' friends have led him to a stripping booth, his fri inserts the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're not back by morning we'll  send a search party for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye! No drinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His friends leave, closing the door behind them. A screen goes up and a striptease begins. The lady is dre in the style of a firewoman and has a pole in the center stage. She dances around the pole and removes clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you from here or just visiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lil of both, I grew up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you've seen all the old faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your voice sounds very familiar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deni..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The screen goes down again, Chris leaves the booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look who's back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, good surprise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Told you it was better than gambling.  You met Candy? (A girl is dancing on  their table)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Candy. (to the guys) Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 6! Easy 6 for a win!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To some girls) We can do a 6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Chris) We're gettin killed out here.  I need you to put 200 down for the bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, hell no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at them (Nods to girls).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five hundred on 6?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm in. Boom! Gimme some dice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris notices something odd, he looks concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lookin' for a 6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy. Don't roll. Gimme the dice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lookin' for a 6. Ohhhhh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dice have landed and it's a 7. Jimmy hangs his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To the croupier) You're good, but I  saw it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saw what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw the switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey this is a clean game asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris puts a load of money on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bet you I'll roll a seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not your roll sir. SIR! It's not  your roll. Call security.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris has taken the dice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put your bets down on the pass line.  These dice are comin up seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris, why don't we just let it go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we gonna let it ride Jimmy. The  dice are comin up seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not your roll sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris rolls the dice and sure enough it's a seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No folks, no payout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To croupier) Why don't you just take  care of that bet and we're even.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I would but it wasn't a legitimate  bet, you're not the shooter. It's not  your (Chris shoves him) ROLL sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yea, the problem is your dice are loaded.  Does your boss know about this? Just  gimme my money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The security guy grabs Chris around the neck. Chris elbow and throws him onto the table. The croupier takes a fight stance. Jimmy taps Chris on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, let's go! let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More security men appear, one of them knocks Jimmy out. A fight breaks out, Ray gets knocked out. Chris beats off s security men before taking an electric shock to the neck a baton to the face. Chris wakes up on a table under a li

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sees the tag around Chris' neck) Special  forces? I'll take that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris grabs him by the neck but they beat him down again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Has a scalpel in his hand) Special  forces... special treatment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rips open Chris' shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy knows Hamilton!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A struggle ensues and Chris' chest is cut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Chris is crawling, badly hurt. A truck stops direc in front of him. Chris passes out again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Chris' family) Folks, he's pretty  banged up, inside and out. Whoever did  this left him for dead. A lesser man  wouldn't have survived.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna need a statement from him  Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in no condition to give you one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll also need a copy of your write-up  along with toxicoloy, blood alcohol  level and so on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talkin about Stan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just tryin to get some facts here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh come on you need to be out arresting  whoever tried to kill my brother not  testing his BLOOD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just doing my job Michelle. Ok?  I understand how you feel. But we still  don't know yet who started all of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it wasn't Chris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just find out who did this to him Stan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do my best Mr Vaughn. I really  will. In the meantime I have to file  a full report. You lemme know when I  can talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gonna be fine Michelle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray goes into a room and takes a big bunch of flowers fro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEAUTIFUL flowers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, they're for my best friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey sarge, so much for our VIP... status.  Don't they teach you any fighting skills  in the army.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not good. But I tell you, that guy was  feelin me this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris begins to laugh but is in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some homecoming hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if you've noticed but this  aint exactly home any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris has returned home. He's still in bad shape and his help him out of the car. He insists on taking the steps b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's some old crutches in the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A montage ensues with Chris on the couch, sometimes with other times with Pete. Chris is recovering, and is exerci by the end of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris pulls the cover off an old truck. He smiles and get He starts the engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Changed the plugs a while back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Appreciate that Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might've had serious issues with your  career choice but just didn't seem fair  to take it out on an innocent truck.  Where you headin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was goin into town to get some supplies.  Wanna come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya whole life, all you wanted to do  was get outta here. What made you come  back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna think I'm crazy. I been thinking  about the mill. When I was a kid goin  to visit you at work, the smell of that  fresh-cut cedar. You remember that smell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm I remember a lotta nice things before  the mill closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did they go outta business? (Nods  to a closed supply store).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closed about six months ago. There's  a home depot about fifteen minutes up  the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that? (Nods to an adult XXX shop)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay pulls up in his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. First of all I wanna say thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's been fired, and his gaming permit's  been pulled. I don't know how my security  cameras didn't catch that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay starts to help Chris taking wood off the truck but Ch throws it back on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They miss a lot at your place don't  they Jay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look Chris I hate seein ya like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your boys did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait wait... so they got a little rough,  they were a bit edgy. Understandably.  You don't know what kind of assholes  they have to put up with on a daily  basis. Look, they've been reprimanded.  They say you went nuts man. I'm sorry.  I know the proper term vets use is post  traumatic stress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever it was, you tore my place apart  and it wasn't easy for me to get my  guys agree not to press charges. Look  Chris, if you had a problem... shouldn't  you have come to me? Look, I wanna bring  you inside. Chris I wanna make you head  of security. Whaddya say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah well. I guess you probably need time  to think about it. This is for you.  It's a little something to help you  get... Y'know..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts down an envelope with money in it. Chris gives it to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on man, don't be like that. I came  all the way out here to your house just  to see you get back on your feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm goin to the sheriff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry you feel that way. I'll see  ya round Chris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An officer is on the phone ignoring him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sheriff comes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well hey Chris. Good to see you up and  about, you're lookin spiffy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here to press charges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well this isn't about that incident  at the casino a while back is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yea, it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause that matter's closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you look into it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They did an internal investigation.  That's good enough for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An internal investigation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris, I know you're familiar with the  term 'no fly zone'. Hmm? Cause that's  what the casino is. Since the mill closed  down that casino is the main source  of revenue in this town. So, case closed  basically. I'll see ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna let this stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me? What did you say to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I'm not gonna let this stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lucky to be alive right now,  that's all you need to be concentrating  on. This is my town ok, I'm the sheriff  here. I'll tell you what will stand,  not the other way around. Now please  get out of my building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deni is at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This belongs to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands him a leather jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate that, I thought this was  history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coulda left it in the trash but I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deni? Nice to see you dear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Mrs Vaughn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I talk to you outside for a second.  Mom I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talked to the sheriff yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I went down to the police station  and I talked to somebody with a badge.  Sure as hell didn't seem like much of  a sheriff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's up for re-election you know. Maybe  you could take his job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody ought to. How about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunshine and pine trees. Been readin  these books, teach you how to cultivate  happiness. Books on the future, go with  the flow, that sorta thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it workin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have my moments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So the casino huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. Been there almost a year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Treatin you good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lot better than it treated you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like that. Jay Hamilton's done well  for himself hasn't he.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yea, he's a real go-getter that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be. I heard he got you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lasted about 8 minutes, a long long  time ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still work for him though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rent's gotta be paid Chris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suppose so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope to see you around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She begins to drive off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She toots the horn as she goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connie is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Vaughn's truck pulls up at speed. They enter a garage is on a stretcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's ok mom he's stabilised. (To Chris)  It was close. Crystal Meth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I never did it before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true. We mighta kinda pushed him  into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris approaches the kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you get the drugs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not really sure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop. Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the security guys workin at the  casino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris gets into his truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris, wait. Call the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that won't do any good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris speeds off. He pulls up at their home and enters th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Pete ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris is searching about and forces open a cupboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris pulls out a shotgun and loads it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw Chris not like this. Chris listen  to me. If you go outta here with that  gun, they're gonna.. ne... Chris!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris drives to the casino, he cocks the shotgun but deci to leave it in the truck. Instead he takes a piece of woo the back of his truck. He enters the casino with it. He s a fruit machine. A guard comes up and Chris beats him. A scene breaks out with Chris beating the guards and genera trashing the place. He takes back his special forces dogt the guard who stole it. Chris hurls his piece of wood at VIP lounge window, smashing it to pieces. Jay emerges fro it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess that changes our relationship  a bit huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris leaves. As he drives off in his truck, police cars with sirens going. He pulls over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should NOT have come looking for  trouble. Keep your hands up, get out  of the vehicle now Chris! NOW!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I advise you to give this offer more  than a little serious thought. If you  go to trial you stand to do 18 years.  This is a sweet plea, normally they  wouldn't even put it on the table but  your military record can't be ignored.  Three months home arrest, some community  service. Pretty generous offer Chris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'd have to plead guilty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at it from the other side. There's  over a dozen witnesses, none of em are  gonna paint a very flattering picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a montage of casino workers badmouthing Chris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He started bustin up the machines...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a gunshot..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Went crazy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Complete psychopath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're only offering me this deal just  to keep me quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I still say you should take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't wrong. And I won't say I was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our job is to keep order. But there  was no chance of that. Me and my men  we were just tryin to control him. He  was highly trained, violent, very dangerous  person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So dangerous, so violent, so highly  trained that he despatched six of the  casino staff single handedly. His weapon  of choice a simple piece of cedar. Which  in his hand became a devastating force  with one aim, to hurt people, destroy  property.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He went directly for everything. He  just came in and took over the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said he broke your arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yea that's correct, my right forearm.  Both bones with a single shot. It was  crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, toss out a coupla drunks now  and then. Guys try to grope the girls,  but ah nothing with this sort of violence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he give you any kind of advanced  warning? A chance to defend yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We tussled, but he's a big guy. He was  on a mission. Besides, he seemed to  be too busy enjoying himself from what  I could see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So from what you saw, it seemed like  he had some kinda purpose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he had a point to prove yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was emptyin machines when Mr Vaugh  came in and started swingin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was tryin to get outta there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr Crow, you may present your client's  case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To his lawyer) You're fired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your honor, I'd like to plead my own  case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Order, order. Mr Vaughn, if you choose  to represent yourself and not be represented  by legal counsel you realise that you  can't then claim a mistrial on that  basis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well Mr Vaughn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't deny anything that was said  here today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does that mean you're changing your  plea to guilty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not guilty of anything. Except standing  up for myself when the law wouldn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection. He's trying to introduce  prior events your honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sustained. Mr Vaughn stay on point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I grew up in this town. People used  to walk tall in this town, they wouldn't  have traded the mill for a crooked casino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr Vaughn we're not here to listen to  civic speeches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they wouldn't have stood around  while drugs were being sold to kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sustained. Mr Vaughn you're close to  being held in contempt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was justified in what I did, and if  you acquit me of these charges I'm gonna  run for sheriff. And if elected, I'm  gonna fix this town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Order, order. Mr Vaughn you are now  charged with contempt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I will make sure that THIS (He opens  his shirt revealing huge scarring) never  happens to anyone again without punishing  those who did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I order the jury to ignore what they  have just seen. Mr Vaughn take your  seat. Order! Order!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr Forman, has the jury reached a verdict?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have your honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will the defendant please rise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We find the defendant Chris Vaughn not  guilty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd breaks into cheer. Chris takes a tag from his p of cedar wood which is laying on the evidence table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowds fade away with chants of 'Sheriff Vaughn'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris pulls up to the station in his police truck, it's c he's now the sheriff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watkins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you won the election, congratulations.  We do have a tradition of professional  courtesy up here, and I can personally  vouch for each and every one of these  men. They're good deputies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're all fired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris takes a look around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay is speeding along in a sportscar. He is pulled over b police truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Chris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: License and registration please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're joking right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: License and registration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay hands it over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the problem sheriff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You. And the drugs you're pedalling  out of your casino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Only thing that's going on in my  casino right now is reconstruction.  You took care of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yea that's right and I plan on taking  care of everything else too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you can, try to think this through.  A casino is a license to print money.  Why would I jeopardise that by selling  drugs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause you owned the town Jay. It's changed  now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? See the only thing that I think  has changed around here is that every  morning you get to wake up and put on  that nifty lil badge. But underneath  that badge is the same guy that couldn't  make it playing college football, apparently  couldn't make it in the army and not  gonna make it as a cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yea, and if you push too hard you're  gonna be a man who doesn't live to see  40. License please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris hands it over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks sheriff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir get your tail lights fixed, it's  your last warning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with my tail lights?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris smashes up the back end of Jay's car with his trust of cedar wood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mornin sheriff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mornin deputy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris tosses Ray a badge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, nope, no. Come on man you know I  hate cops. You been sheriff 2 minutes  and I'm already startin to hate you.  I'm a convicted felon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a lil pull around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh now you're a CROOKED cop doing favours  for friends. That's how it starts. See  next thing you know you'll be taking  bribes, setting up roadblocks, frisking  dudes crotches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you done? Ray I need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh don't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to take me to drugs school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get to wear a uniform?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A montage ensues, with Chris and Ray busting various drug

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're SURE you're not carrying anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Search him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Spread your legs, arms down. Been  workin out? Nothin there. Ohhhh somebody  needs a BATH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you read me my rights and take me  in. And I call my lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: K. I have a hunch there may be somethin  else in here (Pats the dealer's truck).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music plays while the two chop up the dealer's car into p while laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's clean. Guess we gotta move to plan  B.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw you, I do have a bit of information  for you. It's not just me actually,  there's a whole lotta people in on this  one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spit it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna get hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris is in the room with a shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why does it always have to be your fight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might need this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I put my guns down a long time ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just being stubborn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and me both boy. Chris, listen.  You be careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Booth is locked up, Ray is taunting him through a loudspe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please step away from the vehicle. Now  Mr Booth are you still upset over that  body cavity search? WOOOOOOOO! I forgot,  you got no vehicle. Please disperse,  there is nothing to s...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris has walked in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I talk to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna stay with him tonight. I need  you to take care of my parent's place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think they're gonna take it that  far?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris hands him the shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm with you man, I'll check in later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kay.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT TIME
dialogues.text: Deni comes into the police station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't shoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. How's the food around here? Brought  you special treats. Salmon, Fried Chicken,  Potato Salad. You got cups?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you have to work tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm I quit. I figured you know, you  were making some changes around here,  I could make a few myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris grabs her and they kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray is on the couch and has just woken to a noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Pete. Want something to eat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I'm good man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta get a bigger bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no you don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay calls a number on his celphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got leftovers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm mmm, I want pancakes, and eggs, and  bacon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A loud explosion happens, it's Chris' police truck outsid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WOOOOOOOOOOOO! I told you Vaughn! Uh  ohhhh. Who needs to step away from the  vehicle now Vaughn? Truck for truck  baby, that's right, truck for a truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris steps towards the front of the building but men out open fire, Chris ducks for cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Deni) Get down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete, somethin's burnin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Men with machine guns are still firing at the police stat Deni's screaming, Booth is cheering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take that and get in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris gives Deni a pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray steps into the kitchen but gunmen have infiltrated th A fight breaks out and Pete flees. Ray jumps onto the bac a gunman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris shoots up the floor with a shotgun and breaks a hol it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray stabs the gunman with a potato peeler and knocks him with a frying pan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Deni) Come here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get down into the hole in the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I say 'now' start shooting, over  there. Stay low.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Booth is now under fire and is scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaughn you gotta get me outta here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two other gunmen in stocking masks are holding the family upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know who you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gunman takes off his mask and hits him with a pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Calling downstairs) Burke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes downstairs to find Burke dead on the kitchen floo follows traces of blood across the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris is making his way towards Booth under fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon! Get me outta here man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it worth to you? Where's the  lab?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gunshots hit near booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok! Ok! Hamilton's operation is at the  mill ok! It's at the mill now get me  outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gunman enters a room, Ray is there pointing a shotgun him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Booth is standing and gets shot dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray shoots the gunman, who falls to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Booth is dead so Chris leaves him there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To gunman's body on the floor) Hey..  you okay?

dialogues.speaker: UPSTAIRS
dialogues.text: Gunman 2 looks away for a second and Michelle kicks him d the stairs. As he tumbles down Ray reloads his shotgun. T begin firing at each other, taking cover behind the furni

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tried to warn ya Chris. Didn't want  this to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the men outside has a canister. Watkins gives him nod and he begins walking towards the station. Chris is b the floor and shoots him in the legs. The two remaining m open fire again. Another gunman tries to approach but he' in the legs as well. Watkins enters the station and fires at the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come get some! WOOOOOOOOO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deni! Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deni fires off some shots. Watkins is distracted by the s Chris appears in the floor hole and blasts Watkins at clo with a shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deni.... Deni.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris climbs out of the hole and they hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shots are still being fired in the lounge. Ray and the gu begin to wrestle. Ray wins and punches the man repeatedly has come back to the house and tries to pull Ray off the Ray mistakenly hits Chris in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris helps Ray over to a chair, Ray has taken a shot to leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The injured gunman from the kitchen appears brandishing a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stabbed me... with a potato peeler??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris and Ray hold up their hands. He aims at Ray but he' in the back of the head by Dad who is approaching down th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna be ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris is in a police car driving at speed. He approaches mill and busts through the locked gates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mill is dark, Chris is finding his way around using a He finds Jay sitting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Chris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up Jay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a sec. Remember we used to play  hide n seek up here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay hits a metal saw which resonates making a metallic so

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was my favourite sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay stands up and holds up his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look... Chris... just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay hits a switch on the floor which opens a hatch. Chris into the hatch but hangs onto the saw which is swinging o it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay hits more switches, powering up the machinery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna know what my new favourite  sound's gonna be? The sound of you screaming  like a little bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay hits Chris in the stomach with a pole a few times. Ch grabs the pole and they both fall. Chris has hurt his leg stumbles off into the woods. Jay grabs an axe and goes af him, he swings the axe but misses and they both fall down earthy embankment. At the bottom they come to their sense begin fighting again, Jay with his axe and Chris with a l ripped off a tree. Chris knocks Jay out by hitting him ha the legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right Jay, this does change our  relationship. This is my town, you're  under arrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris and Ray are packing everything, the place is boarde

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That oughta do it. WHAT are you doin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gettin some souvenirs, I'm gonna miss  the place!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how it starts. Next you'll be  accepting bribes, setting speed traps  all over town, cuttin up trucks. Not  to mention the cavity searches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speakin of which, do you think Jay's  got a casino in the pen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Runnin the shower tower with the felons.  He's probably blowin on somebody's dice  right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They laugh as they drive off. The mill makes a horn noise

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go pick my old man and grab somethin  to eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm with ya buddy.
